title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 651.5 - State charges (monthly report)
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 651.5 - State charges (monthly report)

State Regulations
(a) Public welfare agencies shall report, monthly, data other than vendor medical information, on form SC-33 consisting
of three sections as follows: (1)

State
charges under care during the month; (2)
payments made during the month; (3)
removals and burials. (b) A report on all dependent

Indians living on reservations shall be submitted by the social services
districts. The report shall cover a calendar month. Beginning with the month of

July 1947, the original of the revised report on form SC-33 shall be submitted
to the office by the 15th day of the month following the month for which the
report is prepared. (1)

An approved State
charge is a person for whom a written approval has been given by the office and
filed with the social services district. (2)
A presumptive State charge is a person
who, in the opinion of the social services district, has State charge status, but for whom no written approval has been given by the office. (3)

State charges shall be reported according
to the type of assistance or care received. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18
ยง
651.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
